Posts.EditableText:
Okay, I have been trying to make a game with clothes. But I have a [b:wynf9e9i]big[/b:wynf9e9i] problem. Whenever I try to wear a pair of underwear, or in that case anything, it says:
[b:wynf9e9i] > wear underwear
underwear.....
On second thoughts you decide that the underwear won't suit a woman like you at all.[/b:wynf9e9i]
Why doesn't it function properly? I have the type of the underwear as "Undies". And I am [i:wynf9e9i]sure[/i:wynf9e9i] that I have the q3ext library loaded. So why doesn't it work?
Posts.HTML:
Okay, I have been trying to make a game with clothes. But I have a big problem. Whenever I try to wear a pair of underwear, or in that case anything, it says:
> wear underwear
underwear.....
On second thoughts you decide that the underwear won't suit a woman like you at all.
Why doesn't it function properly? I have the type of the underwear as "Undies". And I am sure that I have the q3ext library loaded. So why doesn't it work?

Posts.EditableText: [b:2rgshoy0]Nevermind! I just got Al's new Typelib, and it works fine now! Thanks for reading, though![/b:2rgshoy0]
Posts.HTML: Nevermind! I just got Al's new Typelib, and it works fine now! Thanks for reading, though!

Posts.EditableText: Jordan wrote: [quote:2dgj39ub] Nevermind! I just got Al's new Typelib, and it works fine now! Thanks for reading, though! [/quote:2dgj39ub] Which version have you got Jordan? It seems that the version from my website is still way out of date (a beta from 2002) rather than the last release (1.009, Sept 2003). Obviously it is better to use the newest version To clear up why you got the *error* you did (because it can still occur in the latest version) - this isn't / wasn't actually an error at all. Typelib allows you to set clothes as being suitable only for females, only for males or unisex. You may also set the player as male or female. If you have clothes set as 'suitable for males only' and a player set to female, you will get exactly the message you encountered. Al
Posts.HTML:
Jordan wrote:


Nevermind! I just got Al's new Typelib, and it works fine now! Thanks for reading, though!


Which version have you got Jordan? It seems that the version from my website is still way out of date (a beta from 2002) rather than the last release (1.009, Sept 2003).

Obviously it is better to use the newest version

To clear up why you got the *error* you did (because it can still occur in the latest version) - this isn't / wasn't actually an error at all.

Typelib allows you to set clothes as being suitable only for females, only for males or unisex. You may also set the player as male or female. If you have clothes set as 'suitable for males only' and a player set to female, you will get exactly the message you encountered.

Al
